body.name: Makita XLC02ZB 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Cordless Vacuum, Tool Only
body.merchantInfo: Sold by Electropedia llc and Fulfilled by Amazon.
features: Upto 33 minutes of continuous use from a single fully charged 18V 5.0Ah LXT battery (battery not included)
Redesigned floor nozzle for improved maneuverability and debris collection
Strong suction power for faster and efficient cleaning
Bagless 2-stage cloth filtration system allows for easier cleaning and quicker debris disposal
Compact and ergonomic design at only 18-3/4" Long
body.description: The Makita 18V LXT Lithium-Ion cordless vacuum (XLC02ZB, Tool only, batteries and charger sold separately) is a compact and powerful solution for fast and efficient cleaning. At only 18-3/4” in length This compact vacuum can be used as a “hand-vac”, or with the floor nozzle extension for floors, carpets, and hard-to-reach spaces. It has a redesigned floor nozzle for improved debris collection, and a bag-less 2-Stage cloth Filtration system for easy cleaning and quick debris disposal. When using an 18V LXT 5.0Ah battery (sold separately), users will get up to 33 minutes of continuous use on a single charge. It is compatible with Makita 18V LXT and 18V LXT compact Lithium-Ion batteries. It’s part of Makita’s expanding 18V Lithium-Ion system, the world’s largest cordless tool system powered by 18V Lithium-Ion slide-style batteries. Makita 18V Lithium-Ion batteries have the fastest charge times in their categories, so they spend more time working and less time sitting on the charger.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Makita XLC02ZB 18V LXT Lithium-ion Cordless Vacuum, Tool Only Features Weighs only 3.2 lbs. with battery (battery not included) for reduced operator fatigue Increased storage capacity for longer time between waste disposal Ergonomic soft grip handle provides increased comfort and control Battery and charger not included Only use genuine Makita batteries and chargers Makita XLC02ZB 18V LXT Lithium-ion Cordless Vacuum, Tool Only Strong Suction Power for Faster Cleaning The Makita 18V LXT Lithium-Ion Cordless Vacuum (XLC02ZB, tool only, batteries and charger sold separately) is a compact and powerful solution for fast and efficient cleaning. At only 18-3/4” in length this compact vacuum can be used as a 'hand-vac', or with the floor nozzle extension for floors, carpets, and hard-to-reach spaces. It has a redesigned floor nozzle for improved debris collection, and a bag-less 2-stage cloth filtration system for easy cleaning and quick debris disposal. When using an 18V LXT 5.0Ah battery (sold separately), users will get up to 33 minutes of continuous use on a single charge. It is compatible with Makita 18V LXT and 18V LXT Compact Lithium-Ion batteries. Includes: Filter (451208-3) Cloth Vacuum Filter (443060-3) Floor Nozzle (123539-7) Crevice Nozzle Holder (456585-8) Crevice Nozzle (456586-6) Extension Attachment (456587-4)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 27, 2023
reviews.reviewText: bought this vacum 2 years ago works good! not for thick or shag carpet great for hard wood tile or any hard suface works good on tight weave carpet perfect for me i dont have any shag style carpet, just wanted to add my review after reading others reviews. this vacum is great for quick clean ups before moping and maintenance! not for deep cleaning on carpets you really need somthing that has a motor driven roller brush for that. the plastic tank does crack and break as i saw on others reviews mine has some cracks. when i saw the cracks i odrered a spare tank for $15.00 havent used it yet but i have it just in case. very easy to use and light wieght beats having to plug in a cord and roll it up you spill you can vacum it up and put the vacum away in a minute or 2 very nice

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 21, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This thing is the best. Compact, but comparable suction to a shop vac. There may be equivalent cheaper options, but I love that I can use my Makita batteries (even the knock off ones) with this vacuum. I keep a battery on it at all times, and the battery will last a few months ( try that with another cordless mini vac). It comes with a helpful hanger so you can mount it away on the wall, or on the side of your tool box. Only wish it came with more than one filter, but when it's time to clean it, I just blow all the dust out with compressed air. Def recommend this, especially when you can get it on sale ( sometimes around 70 bucks).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good Cleaning Power
reviews.reviewText: I own two of these. My first I have had for like 8 years. I use it daily and have five kids. So there’s a lot to clean and ours are used HARD. It vacuums well, battery lasts a decent amount of time, and it is sturdy. My kids use it and have dropped it countless times. Keeps working. One of the best vacuums I have ever bought.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 1, 2019
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Don’t use this for sanding dust, sheetrock dust
reviews.reviewText: Below is my review written a month or two after I bought this two years ago. I still give it four stars even though in the last month it has failed to pick anything up. When I took it apart I realized what happened. My painters had helped themselves to this vacuum and used it to pick up sanding and sheetrock dust and other debris. What you see in the photo if you enlarge it is a ton of sawdust and a bunch of pet hair.I used a real shop vac to get rid of all of the dust and hair and put it together so that it works again but I’m waiting for the cyclonic attachment for this to come on Monday to see if that helps with the filtration problem.I see in the manual that there’s a high-performance filter available for this but it did not come with mine so I’ve been using the “normal pre-filter“ and it obviously doesn’t keep out pet hair. So my advice is to either get the high-performance filter to use over the pre-filter or buy the cyclonic attachment (and you can see the reviews for it on Amazon. I will update with a description of that once I see how it works).Otherwise, this has been a real jam for me and I haven’t had any problem with cracking or battery charging or anything else. I just think Makita could’ve done a better job with filtration. you shouldn’t have to buy a separate attachment for $35 to keep dust out of the inside of a vacuum!Early 2019:I just got this, so can't review longevity. So far here are my pros and cons:PRO: Suction is fantastic! No kickback of granular things like cat litter AT ALL!TIP: Leave the head on the pile you've sucked up for a fraction of a second to give it time to get all of it into the hose. Otherwise some will be left on the floor.PRO: Battery life is great! I charged it maybe 30 mins out of the box and it cleaned my entire kitchen, family room and spots in bedroom bathroom. Still more charge left.CON: The icons on the charger are inscrutable! I still can't figure it all out but when the middle light on the bottom turns green you are good to go.PRO: the head fits in every small areas. It swivels and can run very flat.CON: The head is very small so you have a lot of moving it around compared to something like the Shark Navigator. It is more like a dust buster with a handle.PRO: Because it is more like a dust buster, you don't really vacuum the same way: you just move the vacuum over the whatever and it picks up. No continuous back and forth.PRO: Works great as a hand vac in the car and on the stairs! Does a better job than the carwash does at cleaning out salt and crumbs in the grooves on the seats!PRO: I love the on-board edge cleaner!CON: There is no way to lock the switch ON so you have to constantly hold it down. This is a ridiculous omission considering the Makita drills which do have this feature. My trigger finger would get very tired so it was on/off on/off. Such a simple thing to fix!CON: The handle where you have to grab and trigger the switch is too short by about an inch. I am 5'4 and have very long arms (used to be 5'6) so I can't imagine someone taller being able to use this without bending over.CON: I don't see how you can wall mount the charger and there are no instructions for it. You have to remove the battery from the vac and put it in the charger (tough on my arthritic hands) and leave it setting somewhere until the sound goes off. Shark Navigator has a stand that you set the vac on, it charges and you just leave it there until you need it. I find this lack of abilities in the Makita really problematic.CON: The vac doesn't stand up by itself (but neither does the Shark Navigator).SUMMARY: despite the negatives, the positives are worth it: much better suction. Cleaning the dirt cup is easy...you just rotate it a quarter turn to remove it but you do have to use your fingers to peel off pet hair, if any, and occasionally rinse it out (like the Navigator).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 9, 2024
reviews.reviewText: This works really well!! We have throw rugs on our hardwood floors and this sweeper works great on the rugs and the floor. A whole lot of suction!! Well worth the money.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 4, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great little machine
reviews.reviewText: This vacuum is used to replace a Dyson stick vacuum that the battery went out on. It is lightweight and very easy to use. It’s great on hardwood floors and low carpet. I use Makita tools so I have a lot of 5Ah batteries that will make it run a lot longer. It will run fine on the 2Ah battery that it comes with but just not as long. I ordered the brush attachment and that works well with it. I also ordered the cyclonic filter but it hasn’t arrived yet.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 8, 2024
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Excellent cordless hand vac
reviews.reviewText: This Makita cordless hand vac is amazing! It uses the Makita batteries so it can be used almost anywhere. It's powerful and easy to clean. We're so glad we found it.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on July 15, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars If you were going to buy another handheld vacuum buy this one.
reviews.reviewText: The media could not be loaded. Mom of four kiddos under 9 and I have been in search of the perfect stick vacuum. Last Black Friday I bought an expensive one and it wouldn’t even suck up cheerios. I returned that thing faster than I bought it. Then this year that whole wet/dry vacuum seemed so exciting except for the fact I don’t want to store that thing.My husband is a Makita guy and the laundry list of things it can connect to is awesome.I stumbled across this and thought why not try it. It does everything I want! I dumped some frosted glasses on the floor and boom, no problem. Do I expect a one swipe and done, absolutely not. A couple swipes later and it is gone, the dog was disappointed. I think my favorite thing is the simple design! There is one single filter and an area that collects sand, Frosted Flakes, beads, rainbow loom bands, and other wonderful items. It gives me a quick once over to make sure I am not throwing away a really “valuable” Barbie accessory or something too! It is only day 2 but happy to update after longer use.*A month later and beyond thrilled to own this thing. It truly does what you want and works every single time.
Buena calidad del producto, ligero, fácil de usar
I use it for the run around the house, patio and car and does a job as good as a Dyson and I bet last longer
A very good product serving its purpose very well. One thing... explanation about the charger pictogram is not very clear.
